alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 11:21AM MST until September 10 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HAVASU CREEK BASIN REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST/445 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 1117 AM MST /1217 PM MDT/, Doppler radar and automated river gauges indicated thunderstorms producing moderate rain over the Havasu Creek basin. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The USGS river gauge at Supai (SUPA3) has indicated a 1.5 foot rise in roughly 30 minutes with a current flow of around 500 cubic feet per second (cfs). Flash flooding will continue for the next few hours as water drains. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Havasu Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Havasu Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hualapai Hilltop, Grand Canyon National Park, Hualapai Reservation, Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Black Tank Wash, Pasture Wash, Mohawk Canyon, Colorado River, Little Coyote Canyon, Havasu Creek, Sandstone Wash, Royal Arch Creek, Prospect Valley and Albers Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Campers and hikers should hustle to higher ground immediately! Stay away from creeks and washes! Foot bridges will be washed out in Supai Campground. Some campsites will be flooded. Campers may be stranded in portions of the campground.
